titles.title: Volcanic fumarole gas anlayses from Klyuchevskoy, Tolbachik and Shiveluch Volcanoes (Kamchatka, Russia), 1936-1937

resource.publisher: EarthChem Library(ECL) | Interdisciplinary Earth Data Alliance (IEDA) | Columbia University; doi:10.17616/R3V644

rightsList.rights: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-Share Alike 3.0 United States [CC BY-NC-SA 3.0]

descriptions.description: This dataset is a summary of fumarole gas analyses from Kamachatka region volcanoes from 1936-1937 by I.Z. Ivanov. These analyses were presented in the USSR Science Academy Kamchatka Volcanology Station Bulletin, No. 4. Gas samples are from fumaroles from Klyuchevskoy volcano (Tuyla and Kirgurich craters) and Shiveluch volcano, with one analysis from Tolvachik volcano. Shiveluch samples were collected by Ivanov and geologist A.A. Menyalnov.

Related publications: Ivanov, I.V. (1938),"Volcanic fumarole gas analyses from Klyuchevskoy and Shiveluch volcanoes (Kamchatka, Russia), 1936-1937."USSR Science Academy Kamchatka Volcanology Station Bulletin, 4:13-18

geoLocation.geoLocationPlace: Russia, Kamchatka, Klyuchevskoy, Klyuchevskaya, Klyuchev Crater, Tolbachik Volcano, Shiveluch Volcano, Kirgurich Volcano
